line_1: Thus do I strive, thus arguments invent,
line_2: Thus are my days in fruitless wishes spent:

line_1: TELL me what Genius did the art invent,
line_2: The lively image of the voice to paint;

line_1: Nor grand inquisitor could worse invent,
line_2: Than he contrives to suffer, well content.

line_1: And of all arts sagacious dupes invent
line_2: To cheat themselves and gain the world's assent

line_1: And of all arts sagacious dupes invent
line_2: The worst is scripture warp'd from it's intent.

line_1: Can envious Fiends a Penalty invent
line_2: That shall than Loath'd Embraces more Torment?

line_1: Some story, then, I must invent,
line_2: What could I do! If in I went,

line_1: In vain great Princes mighty things Invent,
line_2: While Heaven retains the Power to prevent:

line_1: And own stale Nonsense which they ne'er invent.
line_2: They reason and conclude by Precedent,

line_1: Tho' polish'd manners may fresh wants invent,
line_2: And nice distinctions nicer souls torment;

line_1: Than you could name, or mortal brain invent.
line_2: More pangs he feels, his heart by conscience rent,
